title: Ably API Requests Client Event
description: A message sent on the clientEvents:apiRequests metachannel describing a sampled client API request.

host.description: The HTTP Host header of the API request.

requestId.description: The unique ID of the API request that Ably can use to correlate a request event with internal logs, if necessary.

site.description: The site the API request was processed in.

headers.description: The HTTP headers of the API request. Header names are lower case (e.g. 'accept', 'content-type', 'user-agent', etc.).

ably-agent.description: The Ably-Agent header describing the SDK and runtime environment of the client.

x-ably-version.description: The Ably API protocol version expected by the client.

x-geoip.description: Geographic information related to the detected IP address of the client formatted as '<country-code>,<region>,<latitude>,<longitude>'

x-request-start.description: The time the request was received by Ably's routing layer, represented as the number of milliseconds elapsed since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC

query.description: The parsed query component of the API request URL (e.g. {"format":"msgpack"}).

format.description: The format used to encode protocol messages. Either 'json' or 'msgpack'.

path.description: The path component of the API request URL (e.g. /channels/{channel-name}/messages).

channels.description: The list of channels the API request references.

error.description: The details of any error encountered whilst processing the API request.

credential.description: Details of the credential used to authenticate the client.

hasUserClaims.description: Does this token contain user claims.

hasLimitsClaims.description: Does this token contain limits claims.
